data.enText: become/make different
to become different

data.chText: 里克一点儿没变，他和上学时一模一样。
data.enText: Rick hasn't changed. He looks exactly the same as he did at school.

data.chText: 不断变化的对教育的看法
data.enText: changing attitudes towards education

data.chText: 买彩票中奖后她的生活完全变了。
data.enText: Her life changed completely when she won the lottery.
to make sb/sth different

data.chText: 名声并没有使他有丝毫改变。
data.enText: Fame hasn't really changed him.

data.chText: 计算机改变了人的工作方式。
data.enText: Computers have changed the way people work.
to pass or make sb/sth pass from one state or form into another
Caterpillars change into butterflies.
Wait for the traffic lights to change.
The lights changed from red to green.

data.chText: 她魔杖一挥，把青蛙变成了英俊的王子。
data.enText: With a wave of her magic wand, she changed the frog into a handsome prince.
to stop having one state, position or direction and start having another
Leaves change colour in autumn.
The wind has changed direction.
Our ship changed course.
replace
to replace one thing, person, service, etc. with sth new or different

data.chText: 我想另找一位医生看病。
data.enText: I want to change my doctor.

data.chText: 我们的车每两年更换一次。
data.enText: We change our car every two years.

data.chText: 我们换了一辆较大的车。
data.enText: We changed the car for a bigger one.
Marie changed her name when she got married.
She changed her name to his.
That back tyre needs changing.
exchange
to exchange positions, places, etc. with sb else, so that you have what they have, and they have what you have

data.chText: 球队在半场时交换场地。
data.enText: At half-time the teams change ends.

data.chText: 咱们可以交换一下座位吗？
data.enText: Can we change seats?

data.chText: 我可以和您换一下座位吗？
data.enText: Can I change seats with you?
clothes
to put on different or clean clothes
I went into the bedroom to change.
She changed into her swimsuit.

data.chText: 你该把那些湿衣服换掉。
data.enText: You need to change out of those wet things.

data.chText: 我没时间在聚会前更换衣服。
data.enText: I didn't have time to get changed before the party (= to put different clothes on) .

data.chText: 我没时间在聚会前更换衣服。
data.enText: I didn't have time to change clothes before the party.
baby
to put clean clothes or a clean nappy / diaper on a baby
She can't even change a nappy.
The baby needs changing.

data.chText: 我们所有的商店都有供顾客给婴儿换尿布的地方。
data.enText: There are baby changing facilities in all our stores.
bed
to put clean sheets, etc. on a bed
to change the sheets

data.chText: 你帮我换一下床单好吗？
data.enText: Could you help me change the bed?
money

data.chText: 把（货币）兑换（成另一种货币）
data.enText: to exchange money into the money of another country

data.chText: 哪里可以兑换旅行支票？
data.enText: Where can I change my traveller's cheques?
to change dollars into yen
to exchange money for the same amount in different coins or notes

data.chText: 你能把一张20英镑的钞票换成零钱吗？
data.enText: Can you change a £20 note?

data.chText: 把一元美钞换为四个二十五分币
data.enText: to change a dollar bill for four quarters
goods
to exchange sth that you have bought for sth else, especially because there is sth wrong with it; to give a customer a new item because there is sth wrong with the one they have bought

data.chText: 我买的这件衬衫太小，得换件大的。
data.enText: This shirt I bought's too small─I'll have to change it for a bigger one.

data.chText: 夫人，我们当然会给您掉换件大号的。
data.enText: Of course we'll change it for a larger size, Madam.
bus/train/plane
to go from one bus, train, etc. to another in order to continue a journey
Where do I have to change?
Change at Reading (for London).

data.chText: 我为了转机才在莫斯科停留。
data.enText: I stopped in Moscow only to change planes.
change hands
to pass to a different owner
The house has changed hands several times.
change horses in midstream

data.chText: 中流换马；中途变卦；中途支持另外的人（或事）
data.enText: to change to a different or new activity while you are in the middle of sth else; to change from supporting one person or thing to another
change your/sb's mind
to change a decision or an opinion

data.chText: 什么都不能让我改变主意。
data.enText: Nothing will make me change my mind.
change your tune

data.chText: 改变调子；转变态度；变卦
data.enText: to express a different opinion or behave in a different way when your situation changes

data.chText: 等着瞧吧，到他遇上这事时，他很快就会改变调子了。
data.enText: Wait until it happens to him─he'll soon change his tune.
change your ways

data.chText: 开始过另一种生活；换个活法
data.enText: to start to live or behave in a different way from before
chop and change
to keep changing your mind or what you are doing
a leopard cannot change its spots
people cannot change their character, especially if they have a bad character
change sth↔around/round
to move things or people into different positions

data.chText: 你改变了所有家具的位置。
data.enText: You've changed all the furniture around.
change back (into sb/sth)
to return to a previous situation, form, etc.
change back (into sth)
to take off your clothes and put on what you were wearing earlier
She changed back into her work clothes.
change sth back (into sth)
to exchange an amount of money into the currency that it was in before

data.chText: 你可以到银行把没有用掉的美元兑换回英镑。
data.enText: You can change back unused dollars into pounds at the bank.
change down

data.chText: （开车等）换低一挡，换成低速挡，减速
data.enText: to start using a lower gear when you are driving a car, etc.
Change down into second.
change over (from sth) (to sth)
to change from one system or position to another

data.chText: 农场已改用有机肥料的耕作方法。
data.enText: The farm has changed over to organic methods.
change up

data.chText: （开车等）换高一挡，换成高速挡，加速
data.enText: to start using a higher gear when driving a car, etc.
Change up into fifth.
difference
the act or result of sth becoming different
a change in the weather
important changes to the tax system
There was no change in the patient's condition overnight.

data.chText: 她是十分讨厌变革的那种人。
data.enText: She is someone who hates change.

data.chText: 社会 / 政治 / 经济变革
data.enText: social/political/economic change
sth new and interesting

data.chText: （会令人感兴趣或可喜的）变化，变更
data.enText: the fact of a situation, a place or an experience being different from what is usual and therefore likely to be interesting, enjoyable, etc.

data.chText: 能早日结束是个可喜的变化。
data.enText: Finishing early was a welcome change .

data.chText: 咱们今晚换换口味，就待在家里吧。
data.enText: Let's stay in tonight for a change .
Can you just listen for a change ?

data.chText: 破例读到点好消息，真让人高兴。
data.enText: It makes a change to read some good news for once.
replacing sth
the process of replacing sth with sth new or different; a thing that is used to replace sth
a change of address
a change of government
a change from agriculture to industry

data.chText: 我们在迪拜着陆后将更换机组人员。
data.enText: There will be a crew change when we land at Dubai.

data.chText: 咱们出去度周末吧，换换环境会对你有好处的。
data.enText: Let's get away for the weekend. A change of scene (= time in a different place) will do you good.
of clothes
an extra set of clothes, etc.

data.chText: 她已收拾好度周末的一套换洗衣物。
data.enText: She packed a change of clothes for the weekend.

data.chText: 我在车里放有一双供替换的鞋。
data.enText: I keep a change of shoes in the car.
money
the money that you get back when you have paid for sth giving more money than the amount it costs
Don't forget your change!
That's 40p change.
The ticket machine gives change.
coins rather than paper money
Do you have any change for the phone?
a dollar in change (= coins that together are worth one dollar)

data.chText: 我没有零钱留下来付小费。
data.enText: I didn't have any small change (= coins of low value) to leave as a tip.

data.chText: 他把身上的零钱放进了给孩子的钱箱。
data.enText: He puts his loose change in a money box for the children.

data.chText: 你能换给我十英镑的零钱吗？
data.enText: Could you give me change for a ten pound note (= coins or notes that are worth this amount) ?
of bus/train/plane
an occasion when you go from one bus, train or plane to another during a journey
The journey involved three changes.
a change for the better/worse
a person, thing, situation, etc. that is better/worse than the previous or present one
a change of heart

data.chText: 改变态度，改变看法（通常指变得更友好、有益等）
data.enText: if you have a change of heart , your attitude towards sth changes, usually making you feel more friendly, helpful, etc.
a change of mind
an act of changing what you think about a situation, etc.
get no change out of sb

data.chText: （从某人处）得不到帮助，打听不到消息
data.enText: to get no help or information from sb
a wind/the winds of change
an event or a series of events that has started to happen and will cause important changes or results

data.chText: 银行界刮起了改革之风。
data.enText: A wind of change was blowing through the banking world.

means: (会令人感兴趣或可喜的)变化

ex.chText: 女巫把那男孩变成了一只老鼠。
ex.enText: A witch changed the boy into a mouse.

ex.chText: 经济形势已发生了相当大的变化。
ex.enText: The economic situation has changed considerably.

ex.chText: 树叶在秋天改变颜色。
ex.enText: The leaves on the trees change colour in the autumn.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，可指任何变化，强调与原先的情况有明显的不同。

ex.chText: 你的外衣太大了，得找人改一下。
ex.enText: Your coat is too big. You must have it altered.

ex.chText: 工作环境必须改善，以适应新的要求。
ex.enText: The working condition must be altered to meet the new requirements.

synonyms.bx: 常指轻微改变，强调在保持原状的情况下进行局部改变。

ex.chText: 请把这钱兑换成人民币。
ex.enText: Please convert this money into RMB.

ex.chText: 她母亲已改信天主教。
ex.enText: Her mother has converted to Catholicism.

synonyms.bx: 指改变形式、用途、使用方式等，也指改变信仰、观点、态度等。

ex.chText: 这项计划要用就必须修改。
ex.enText: The plan must be modified if it is to be used.

ex.chText: 你最好说得和缓些才是。
ex.enText: You'd better modify your tone.

synonyms.bx: 指对某物作细小的改动以对其进行改进，使其更适用或更高效。

ex.chText: 魔术师把那条手帕变成了一只鸟。
ex.enText: The magician transformed the handkerchief into a bird.

ex.chText: 太阳能可以转化为能量。
ex.enText: Solar energy can be transformed into power.

synonyms.bx: 指在形式、外观、性质等方面彻底改变，即成为全新的东西。

ex.chText: 煤可以转化成热。
ex.enText: Coal can be turned into heat.

ex.chText: 他把这本小说变成了英语畅销书。
ex.enText: He turned this novel into an English best-seller.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指外形、颜色、气味、性质等方面发生变化。

ex.chText: 鱼的价格随着市场行情而变化。
ex.enText: The prices of fish vary according to market conditions.

ex.chText: 老年人不喜欢改变他们的习惯。
ex.enText: Old people don't like to vary their habits.

synonyms.bx: 指根据某一情况的变化而变化，也指更改某事物。

ex.chText: 她身上总带着现金。
ex.enText: She always has cash on her.

ex.chText: 我付你现金还是支票？
ex.enText: Shall I pay you in cash or check?

ex.chText: 现金付款的话，我们给予9折优惠。
ex.enText: We give 10 percent discount for cash.

synonyms.bx: 指随时可以支付的钱币，而非支票、信用卡等。

ex.chText: 先生，这是找你的钱。
ex.enText: Here is the change, sir.

ex.chText: 这台自动售票机可以找零。
ex.enText: This ticket machine gives change.

ex.chText: 他没有零钱留下来付小费。
ex.enText: He had no small change to leave as a tip.

synonyms.bx: 指买东西找回的钱，或小面值零钱。

ex.chText: 她付给他硬币。
ex.enText: She paid him in coins.

ex.chText: 鲍勃喜欢收集外国硬币。
ex.enText: Bob likes to collect foreign coins.

synonyms.bx: 指用各种金属制成的钱币，如金币、银币、铜币等。

ex.chText: 桌上有共值500英镑的纸币若干张。
ex.enText: There are five hundred pounds in notes on the desk.

ex.chText: 他给了我5张50美元面额的钞票。
ex.enText: He gave me five fifty-dollar notes.

synonyms.bx: 指纸币，相当于 bank note。

data.enText: change hands
to pass to a different owner
The house has changed hands several times.
change horses in midstream

data.chText: 中流换马；中途变卦；中途支持另外的人（或事）
data.enText: to change to a different or new activity while you are in the middle of sth else; to change from supporting one person or thing to another
change your/sb's mind
to change a decision or an opinion

data.chText: 什么都不能让我改变主意。
data.enText: Nothing will make me change my mind.
change your tune

data.chText: 改变调子；转变态度；变卦
data.enText: to express a different opinion or behave in a different way when your situation changes

data.chText: 等着瞧吧，到他遇上这事时，他很快就会改变调子了。
data.enText: Wait until it happens to him─he'll soon change his tune.
change your ways

data.chText: 开始过另一种生活；换个活法
data.enText: to start to live or behave in a different way from before
chop and change
to keep changing your mind or what you are doing
a leopard cannot change its spots
people cannot change their character, especially if they have a bad character
change/swap places (with sb)
to be in sb else's situation

data.chText: 我幸福极了，谁也甭想跟我交换位置。
data.enText: I'm perfectly happy─I wouldn't change places with anyone.
a change for the better/worse
a person, thing, situation, etc. that is better/worse than the previous or present one
a change of heart

data.chText: 改变态度，改变看法（通常指变得更友好、有益等）
data.enText: if you have a change of heart , your attitude towards sth changes, usually making you feel more friendly, helpful, etc.
a change of mind
an act of changing what you think about a situation, etc.
get no change out of sb

data.chText: （从某人处）得不到帮助，打听不到消息
data.enText: to get no help or information from sb
ring the changes (with sth)
to make changes to sth in order to have greater variety

data.chText: 用一种新的颜色来改变一下。
data.enText: Ring the changes with a new colour.
a wind/the winds of change
an event or a series of events that has started to happen and will cause important changes or results

data.chText: 银行界刮起了改革之风。
data.enText: A wind of change was blowing through the banking world.
change sth↔around/round
to move things or people into different positions

data.chText: 你改变了所有家具的位置。
data.enText: You've changed all the furniture around.
change back (into sb/sth)
to return to a previous situation, form, etc.
change back (into sth)
to take off your clothes and put on what you were wearing earlier
She changed back into her work clothes.
change sth back (into sth)
to exchange an amount of money into the currency that it was in before

data.chText: 你可以到银行把没有用掉的美元兑换回英镑。
data.enText: You can change back unused dollars into pounds at the bank.
change down

data.chText: （开车等）换低一挡，换成低速挡，减速
data.enText: to start using a lower gear when you are driving a car, etc.
Change down into second.
change over (from sth) (to sth)
to change from one system or position to another

data.chText: 农场已改用有机肥料的耕作方法。
data.enText: The farm has changed over to organic methods.
change up

data.chText: （开车等）换高一挡，换成高速挡，加速
data.enText: to start using a higher gear when driving a car, etc.
Change up into fifth.

tr: the action of changing something
example: the change of government had no impact on the economy
his change on abortion cost him the election

tr: a different or fresh set of clothes
example: she brought a change in her overnight bag

tr: a thing that is different
example: he inspected several changes before selecting one

tr: a difference that is usually pleasant
example: he goes to France for variety
it is a refreshing change to meet a woman mechanic

tr: an event that occurs when something passes from one state or phase to another
example: the change was intended to increase sales
this storm is certainly a change for the worse
the neighborhood had undergone few modifications since his last visit years ago

tr: the result of alteration or modification
example: there were marked changes in the lining of the lungs
there had been no change in the mountains

tr: money received in return for its equivalent in a larger denomination or a different currency
example: he got change for a twenty and used it to pay the taxi driver

tr: the balance of money received when the amount you tender is greater than the amount due
example: I paid with a twenty and pocketed the change

tr: coins of small denomination regarded collectively
example: he had a pocketful of change

tr: a relational difference between states
especially between states before and after some event
example: he attributed the change to their marriage

tr: undergo a change
become different in essence
losing one's or its original nature
example: She changed completely as she grew older
The weather changed last night

tr: become different in some particular way, without permanently losing one's or its former characteristics or essence
example: her mood changes in accordance with the weather
The supermarket's selection of vegetables varies according to the season

tr: cause to change
make different
cause a transformation
example: The advent of the automobile may have altered the growth pattern of the city
The discussion has changed my thinking about the issue

tr: exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
example: Could you convert my dollars into pounds?
He changed his name
convert centimeters into inches
convert holdings into shares

tr: remove or replace the coverings of
example: Father had to learn how to change the baby
After each guest we changed the bed linens

tr: change clothes
put on different clothes
example: Change before you go to the opera

tr: lay aside, abandon, or leave for another
example: switch to a different brand of beer
She switched psychiatrists
The car changed lanes

tr: become deeper in tone
example: His voice began to change when he was 12 years old
Her voice deepened when she whispered the password

tr: change from one vehicle or transportation line to another
example: She changed in Chicago on her way to the East coast

tr: give to, and receive from, one another
example: Would you change places with me?
We have been exchanging letters for a year

value.def: If there is a change in something, it becomes different.

example.ex: The ambassador appealed for a change in US policy...
example.tran: 大使呼吁美国在政策上作出改变。

example.ex: What is needed is a change of attitude on the part of architects...
example.tran: 现在需要的是建筑师态度的转变。

example.ex: There are going to have to be some drastic changes...
example.tran: 一定得进行重大变革。

example.ex: In Zaire political change was on its way...
example.tran: 在扎伊尔，政治变革正在推进。

example.ex: 1998 was an important year for everyone: a time of change.
example.tran: 1998年对所有人来说都是重要的一年：那是个变革的时期。

value.def: If you say that something is a change or makes a change, you mean that it is enjoyable because it is different from what you are used to.

example.ex: It is a complex system, but it certainly makes a change...
example.tran: 这是个复杂的体系，不过确实有所改变。

example.ex: Do you feel like you could do with a change?
example.tran: 你想不想改变一下？

value.def: If you change from one thing to another, you stop using or doing the first one and start using or doing the second.

example.ex: His doctor increased the dosage but did not change to a different medication...
example.tran: 他的医生加大了剂量，不过没有换药。

example.ex: He changed from voting against to abstaining.
example.tran: 他原打算投反对票，后来改为弃权了。

value.def: When something changes or when you change it, it becomes different.

example.ex: We are trying to detect and understand how the climates change...
example.tran: 我们正努力探寻并理解气候是如何变化的。

example.ex: In the union office, the mood gradually changed from resignation to rage...
example.tran: 在工会办公室，情绪慢慢从顺从转变成愤怒。

example.ex: She has now changed into a happy, self-confident woman...
example.tran: 如今她已经变成一个快乐、自信的女人。

example.ex: They should change the law to make it illegal to own replica weapons...
example.tran: 他们应该修订法律，使拥有仿制武器成为非法行为。

example.ex: Trees are changing colour earlier than last year...
example.tran: 今年树木换装比去年早。

example.ex: He is a changed man since you left...
example.tran: 打你走后，他就变了个人。

example.ex: A changing world has put pressures on the corporation.
example.tran: 日新月异的世界使这家公司感到了压力。

value.def: To change something means to replace it with something new or different.

example.ex: I paid £80 to have my car radio fixed and I bet all they did was change a fuse...
example.tran: 我花80英镑让人把我车上的收音机修了修，可我敢肯定，他们只是换了根保险丝。

example.ex: If you want to change your doctor there are two ways of doing it.
example.tran: 你要是想换个医生，办法有两个。

example.ex: A change of leadership alone will not be enough.
example.tran: 仅仅更换领导层是不够的。

value.def: When you change your clothes or change, you take some or all of your clothes off and put on different ones.

example.ex: Ben had merely changed his shirt...
example.tran: 本仅仅换了件衬衫。

example.ex: They had allowed her to shower and change...
example.tran: 他们准许她冲个澡，换套衣裳。

example.ex: I  changed into a tracksuit...
example.tran: 我换上一身运动装。

example.ex: I've got to get changed first. I've got to put my uniform on.
example.tran: 我得先换一下衣服，穿上制服。

value.def: A change of clothes is an extra set of clothes that you take with you when you go to stay somewhere or to take part in an activity.

example.ex: He stuffed a bag with a few changes of clothing.
example.tran: 他往包里塞了几套换洗衣服。

value.def: When you change a bed or change the sheets, you take off the dirty sheets and put on clean ones.

example.ex: After changing the bed, I would fall asleep quickly...
example.tran: 换了床单，我很快就能睡着。

example.ex: I changed the sheets on your bed today.
example.tran: 我今天把你的床单换了。

value.def: When you change a baby or change its nappy or diaper, you take off the dirty one and put on a clean one.

example.ex: She criticizes me for the way I feed or change him...
example.tran: 她批评我不会给他喂奶、不会换尿布。

example.ex: He needs his nappy changed.
example.tran: 他的尿布该换了。

value.def: When you change buses, trains, or planes or change, you get off one bus, train, or plane and get on to another in order to continue your journey.

example.ex: At Glasgow I changed trains for Greenock...
example.tran: 我在格拉斯哥改乘去格里诺克的火车。

example.ex: We were turned off the train at Hanover, where we had to change.
example.tran: 我们在汉诺威站被赶下火车，只好在那儿转车。

value.tran: 转乘，换乘(交通工具);转车;转机

value.def: When you change gear or change into another gear, you move the gear lever on a car, bicycle, or other vehicle in order to use a different gear.

example.ex: The driver tried to change gear, then swerved...
example.tran: 司机试图换挡，接着突然转向。

example.ex: He looked up into the mirror as he changed through his gears.
example.tran: 他一边换挡，一边抬眼看后视镜。

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 shift

value.def: Your change is the money that you receive when you pay for something with more money than it costs because you do not have exactly the right amount of money.

example.ex: 'There's your change.' — 'Thanks very much.'...
example.tran: “您的找头。”——“多谢。”

example.ex: They told the shopkeeper to keep the change.
example.tran: 他们告诉店主不用找钱了。

value.def: Change is coins, rather than paper money.

example.ex: Thieves ransacked the office, taking a sack of loose change...
example.tran: 窃贼洗劫了办公室，拿走了一口袋散币。

example.ex: The man in the store won't give him change for the phone unless he buys something.
example.tran: 店里的人不肯给他换硬币打电话，除非他买点什么。

value.def: If you have change for larger notes, bills, or coins, you have the same value in smaller notes, bills, or coins, which you can give to someone in exchange.

example.ex: The courier had change for a £10 note.
example.tran: 快递员能破开10英镑的纸币。

defx.def: If you make change, you give someone smaller notes, bills, or coins, in exchange for the same value of larger ones.

value.def: When you change money, you exchange it for the same amount of money in a different currency, or in smaller notes, bills, or coins.

example.ex: You can expect to pay the bank a fee of around 1% to 2% every time you change money...
example.tran: 每次到银行换币都会要求付1%到2%的手续费。

example.ex: If you travel frequently, find an agency that will change one foreign currency directly into another.
example.tran: 如果经常旅行，找一家能直接兑换外币的旅行社。

value.def: If you say that you are doing something or something is happening for a change, you mean that you do not usually do it or it does not usually happen, and you are happy to be doing it or that it is happening.

example.ex: Now let me ask you a question, for a change...
example.tran: 现在换我来问你一个问题吧。

example.ex: Liz settled back in her seat, comfortably relaxed, enjoying being driven for a change.
example.tran: 莉兹舒服放松地倚在座位上，享受着换别人开车的惬意。
